an5.48:1.3.pli: ‘Jarādhammaṁ mā jīrī’ti alabbhanīyaṁ ṭhānaṁ samaṇena vā brāhmaṇena vā devena vā mārena vā brahmunā vā kenaci vā lokasmiṁ.
an5.48:1.3.en: That [38;5;121msomeone liable to old age[0m should not grow old.

an5.48:2.1.en: An uneducated ordinary person has [38;5;121msomeone liable to old age[0m who grows old.

an5.48:2.3.pli: ‘na kho mayhevekassa jarādhammaṁ jīrati, atha kho yāvatā sattānaṁ āgati gati cuti upapatti sabbesaṁ sattānaṁ jarādhammaṁ jīrati.
an5.48:2.3.en: ‘It’s not just me who has [38;5;121msomeone liable to old age[0m who grows old. For as long as sentient beings come and go, pass away and are reborn, they all have [38;5;121msomeone liable to old age[0m who grows old.

an5.48:2.4.pli: Ahañceva kho pana jarādhamme jiṇṇe soceyyaṁ kilameyyaṁ parideveyyaṁ, urattāḷiṁ kandeyyaṁ, sammohaṁ āpajjeyyaṁ, bhattampi me nacchādeyya, kāyepi dubbaṇṇiyaṁ okkameyya, kammantāpi nappavatteyyuṁ, amittāpi attamanā assu, mittāpi dummanā assū’ti.
an5.48:2.4.en: If I were to sorrow and pine and lament, beating my breast and falling into confusion, just because [38;5;121msomeone liable to old age[0m grows old, I’d lose my appetite and my physical appearance would deteriorate. My work wouldn’t get done, my enemies would be encouraged, and my friends would be dispirited.’

an5.48:2.5.pli: So jarādhamme jiṇṇe socati kilamati paridevati, urattāḷiṁ kandati, sammohaṁ āpajjati.
an5.48:2.5.en: And so, when [38;5;121msomeone liable to old age[0m grows old, they sorrow and pine and lament, beating their breast and falling into confusion.

an5.48:4.1.pli: Sutavato ca kho, bhikkhave, ariyasāvakassa jarādhammaṁ jīrati.
an5.48:4.1.en: An educated noble disciple has [38;5;121msomeone liable to old age[0m who grows old.

an5.48:4.3.pli: ‘na kho mayhevekassa jarādhammaṁ jīrati, atha kho yāvatā sattānaṁ āgati gati cuti upapatti sabbesaṁ sattānaṁ jarādhammaṁ jīrati.
an5.48:4.3.en: ‘It’s not just me who has [38;5;121msomeone liable to old age[0m who grows old. For as long as sentient beings come and go, pass away and are reborn, they all have [38;5;121msomeone liable to old age[0m who grows old.

an5.48:4.4.pli: Ahañceva kho pana jarādhamme jiṇṇe soceyyaṁ kilameyyaṁ parideveyyaṁ, urattāḷiṁ kandeyyaṁ, sammohaṁ āpajjeyyaṁ, bhattampi me nacchādeyya, kāyepi dubbaṇṇiyaṁ okkameyya, kammantāpi nappavatteyyuṁ, amittāpi attamanā assu, mittāpi dummanā assū’ti.
an5.48:4.4.en: If I were to sorrow and pine and lament, beating my breast and falling into confusion, just because [38;5;121msomeone liable to old age[0m grows old, I’d lose my appetite and my physical appearance would deteriorate. My work wouldn’t get done, my enemies would be encouraged, and my friends would be dispirited.’

an5.48:4.5.pli: So jarādhamme jiṇṇe na socati na kilamati na paridevati, na urattāḷiṁ kandati, na sammohaṁ āpajjati.
an5.48:4.5.en: And so, when [38;5;121msomeone liable to old age[0m grows old, they don’t sorrow and pine and lament, beating their breast and falling into confusion.

an5.50:8.3.pli: ‘Jarādhammaṁ mā jīrī’ti alabbhanīyaṁ ṭhānaṁ samaṇena vā brāhmaṇena vā devena vā mārena vā brahmunā vā kenaci vā lokasmiṁ.
an5.50:8.3.en: That [38;5;121msomeone liable to old age[0m should not grow old. …

an5.50:9.1.en: An uneducated ordinary person has [38;5;121msomeone liable to old age[0m who grows old.

an5.50:9.3.pli: ‘na kho mayhevekassa jarādhammaṁ jīrati, atha kho yāvatā sattānaṁ āgati gati cuti upapatti sabbesaṁ sattānaṁ jarādhammaṁ jīrati.

My work wouldn’t get done, my enemies would be encouraged, and my friends would be dispirited.’

an5.50:9.5.pli: So jarādhamme jiṇṇe socati kilamati paridevati, urattāḷiṁ kandati, sammohaṁ āpajjati.
an5.50:9.5.en: And so, when [38;5;121msomeone liable to old age[0m grows old, they sorrow and pine and lament, beating their breast and falling into confusion.

an5.50:11.1.pli: Sutavato ca kho, mahārāja, ariyasāvakassa jarādhammaṁ jīrati.
an5.50:11.1.en: An educated noble disciple has [38;5;121msomeone liable to old age[0m who grows old.

an5.50:11.3.pli: ‘na kho mayhevekassa jarādhammaṁ jīrati, atha kho yāvatā sattānaṁ āgati gati cuti upapatti sabbesaṁ sattānaṁ jarādhammaṁ jīrati.
an5.50:11.3.en: ‘It’s not just me who has [38;5;121msomeone liable to old age[0m who grows old. For all sentient beings have [38;5;121msomeone liable to old age[0m who grows old, as long as sentient beings come and go, pass away and are reborn.

an5.50:11.4.pli: Ahañceva kho pana jarādhamme jiṇṇe soceyyaṁ kilameyyaṁ parideveyyaṁ, urattāḷiṁ kandeyyaṁ, sammohaṁ āpajjeyyaṁ, bhattampi me nacchādeyya, kāyepi dubbaṇṇiyaṁ okkameyya, kammantāpi nappavatteyyuṁ, amittāpi attamanā assu, mittāpi dummanā assū’ti.
an5.50:11.4.en: If I were to sorrow and pine and lament, beating my breast and falling into confusion, just because [38;5;121msomeone liable to old age[0m grows old, I’d lose my appetite and my physical appearance would deteriorate. My work wouldn’t get done, my enemies would be encouraged, and my friends would be dispirited.’

an5.50:11.5.pli: So jarādhamme jiṇṇe na socati na kilamati na paridevati, na urattāḷiṁ kandati, na sammohaṁ āpajjati.
an5.50:11.5.en: And so, when [38;5;121msomeone liable to old age[0m grows old, they don’t sorrow and pine and lament, beating their breast and falling into confusion.

an5.49:3.4.pli: ‘Jarādhammaṁ mā jīrī’ti alabbhanīyaṁ ṭhānaṁ …pe… na socanāya paridevanāya …pe… kammaṁ daḷhaṁ kinti karomi dānī”ti.
an5.49:3.4.en: That [38;5;121msomeone liable to old age[0m should not grow old. … Sorrowing and lamenting doesn’t do even a little bit of good … ‘The karma is strong. What can I do now?’”
